body:
Hi, naeloob.

Thank you very much. That worked. Is it always necessary to use `--include` to copy a single file?

Also the `directory not found` error seemed a bit ambiguous because the source directory exists. That's why I was not sure what the problem was.

Kind regards,
Daniel

Rclone is a tool to copy/sync complete folders, so if you want just a file you have to filter for it.

Remote:Path
You cannot put a filename on the path part. If you want to filter to copy just something from that path you must filter with filter parameters : include, exclude, filters...

Rclone was looking for the Educ.ar/IDC-EQUIPAMIENTO.xlsx directory... and cannot find it.

Hi again, naeloob.

> Remote:Path
> You cannot put a filename on the path part. If you want to filter to 
> copy just something from that path you must filter with filter 
> parameters: include, exclude, filters...
>
> Rclone was looking for the Educ.ar/IDC-EQUIPAMIENTO.xlsx directory... 
> and cannot find it.

Thanks for your reply and the clarification.

Maybe my mistake was thinking the path could contain a filename at the end. When I read the documentation I saw some about that; for example when using the `copyto` parameter [1]. In fact, I had also tried using the `copyto` parameter but it did not work either.

Kind regards,
Daniel

[1] https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_copyto/

Sorry for not responding sooner.

Yes you should be able to copy single files as you have written.

However because this file is a google doc and not an actual file, it isn't working.

This is a bug which needs fixing!

However the workaround suggested by @naeloob using `--include` will work find for google docs and google files.

Hi, Nick!

Thank you for confirming that it is a bug. In the meantime I will use the workaround mentioned by @naeloob.

Kind regards,
Daniel

issue.title: Can't target individual google docs

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello. It seems I cannot target a single google doc using the copy command. 

```
$ rclone ls matt-gdrive:Files
   954211 screenshot1.png
     6194 test.docx             
$ rclone copy matt-gdrive:Files/screenshot1.png .
$ ll
total 932K
-rw-rw-r-- 1 hrunner hrunner 932K Jan 25 20:16 screenshot1.png
$ rclone copy matt-gdrive:Files/test.docx .
2018/01/25 20:21:11 ERROR : : error reading source directory: directory not found
2018/01/25 20:21:11 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors
2018/01/25 20:21:11 ERROR : : error reading source directory: directory not found
2018/01/25 20:21:11 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 1 errors
2018/01/25 20:21:11 ERROR : : error reading source directory: directory not found
2018/01/25 20:21:11 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors
$ rclone copy matt-gdrive:Files/test .
$ ll
total 932K
-rw-rw-r-- 1 hrunner hrunner 932K Jan 25 20:16 screenshot1.png
$ rclone copy matt-gdrive:Files/test . --drive-formats "docx,xlsx,pptx,svg"
$ ll
total 932K
-rw-rw-r-- 1 hrunner hrunner 932K Jan 25 20:16 screenshot1.png
```

The command works perfectly fine if you instead copy the entire directory. As such, you can work around the bug by doing `rclone copy --include "/test.docx" drive:path /path/to/local` instead. 

Here is the log from the faling command:
```
$ rclone -vv copy matt-gdrive:Files/test . --drive-formats "docx,xlsx,pptx,svg"
2018/01/25 20:28:05 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/hrunner/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/01/25 20:28:05 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "copy" "matt-gdrive:Files/test" "." "--drive-formats" "docx,xlsx,pptx,svg"]
2018/01/25 20:28:05 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 1.528864407s (1 consecutive low level retries)
2018/01/25 20:28:05 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/10 (error googleapi: Error 403: Rate Limit Exceeded, rateLimitExceeded)
2018/01/25 20:28:05 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 2.052457542s (2 consecutive low level retries)
2018/01/25 20:28:05 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 2/10 (error googleapi: Error 403: Rate Limit Exceeded, rateLimitExceeded)
2018/01/25 20:28:07 DEBUG : pacer: Resetting sleep to minimum 10ms on success
2018/01/25 20:28:09 INFO  : Local file system at /home/hrunner/Documents: Modify window is 1ms
2018/01/25 20:28:09 DEBUG : screenshot1.png: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2018/01/25 20:28:10 DEBUG : test.docx: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2018/01/25 20:28:10 DEBUG : screenshot1.png: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2018/01/25 20:28:10 INFO  : Local file system at /home/hrunner/Documents: Waiting for checks to finish
2018/01/25 20:28:10 INFO  : Local file system at /home/hrunner/Documents: Waiting for transfers to finish
2018/01/25 20:28:10 INFO  :
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:        4.8s

2018/01/25 20:28:10 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 7
2018/01/25 20:28:10 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "copy" "matt-gdrive:Files/test" "." "--drive-formats" "docx,xlsx,pptx,svg"]
```

I'm running 
```
rclone v1.39
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.9.2
```

I'm on Ubuntu 14.4.3 Trusty, 64 bit. I have **not** tried the command under the latest beta. If that would be helpful let me know and I'd be happy to test. 

Thanks!
Matt

https://forum.rclone.org/t/cant-target-a-single-google-doc/4644

issue.title: drive: fix single Drive Document as FS root

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Allow using Drive Documents as FS root by doing a direcoty list during NewFS.

Fixes #1772

issue.title: Unable to copy a single file Google document from Google Drive - again

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
It appears that this bug is back: https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1772 

I tried on release 1.42 and the latest beta:

$ ./rclone -V
rclone v1.42-035-g99201f8b\u03b2

os/arch: linux/amd64
go version: go1.10.1
$ ./rclone lsl GDrive: --max-size 0
-1 2018-07-14 14:14:55.229000000 newsheet.xlsx
$ ./rclone copy GDrive:/newsheet.xlsx .
2018/07/14 16:39:32 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 0 errors and: object not found
2018/07/14 16:39:33 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 0 errors and: object not found
2018/07/14 16:39:33 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 0 errors and: object not found
2018/07/14 16:39:33 Failed to copy: object not found
[cjn@Shop tmp]$ ./rclone copy GDrive: . --include newsheet.xlsx
[cjn@Shop tmp]$ (success)

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?


#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Centos 7 64bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
